newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti says Italy state entities delay payments.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti says Italy state entities delay payments.

text.p: Olivetti said on Wednesday it was experiencing delays in collecting payments from the Italian Labour ministry and the post office for credits of 210 billion lire outstanding at the end of June.
Olivetti said in a statement in response to questions from market regulator Consob that it had received a payment of 73 billion lire from the post office in August.
Olivetti said in addition to the 210 billion lire in principal outstanding at end June it was also owed more than 30 billion lire in interest on the same date.
The company said there were no grounds to doubt that it would be able to recover the remaining credits. Milan newsroom +392-66102321
